specific_learning_outcomes: identify Kenyan single string musical instruments for cultural appreciation
paint a picture of a Kenyan single stringed musical instrument
improvise a single stringed musical instrument
enjoy playing a single stringed musical instrument
suggested_learning_experiences: in groups, watch live or recorded Kenyan instrumental performances and identify single string instruments (fiddles, ground bows and mouth bows)
in groups, discuss the various local names of Kenyan single string instruments, (fiddles, ground bows and mouth bows)
in pairs, share resources and responsibilities and appropriately mix different colours of water paints (consistency of the paint)
Individually draw and paint a Kenyan single stringed musical instrument using dabbing technique
in groups, discuss simple reusable materials for improvising a single stringed musical instrument (plastic bottles, strings, sticks among others)
in groups, improvise a Kenyan single stringed instrument using assemblage technique (fiddle, ground bow or mouth bow) and observe safety and hygiene by washing hands and cleaning the working area
in groups perform songs using a single stringed instrument while walking
key_inquiry_questions: How are coloured water paints mixed?
Which materials are used for improvising a musical string instrument?
core_competencies: Communication and collaboration: The learner searches for or watches live or recorded Kenyan instrumental performances to identify single string instruments
Creativity and imagination: The learner improvises a single stringed musical instrument using reusable locally available materials
values: Unity: The learner respects others' opinions while discussing single stringed musical instruments
Social justice: The learner shares resources and responsibilities equitably while mixing coloured water paints
Integrity: The learner utilizes resources prudently while painting a single stringed musical instrument
pcis: Health promotion issues: The learner clears the working area and washes hands after improvising a single stringed musical instrument
links_to_other_subjects: Environmental Activities: The learner observes safety and hygiene by washing hands and cleaning the working area after improvising a Kenyan single stringed instrument using assemblage technique

links_to_other_subjects: Environmental Activities: The learner applies knowledge and skills gained in Environmental Activities to create melodic patterns from differently pitched objects such as voiced or tuned percussion
